text: <@U08MT2FTL|jeff> has joined the channel
<--- nntpchan guy
hi <@U08MT2FTL>
reads scrollback
there is a *lot* of scrollback
eh, not too much, for IRC there's usually a lot more when I wake up

Some initial thoughts, I don't think that a true p2p reddit would be adopted because you'd need to install a local application, I've seen that the federated way like with gnusocial and nntpchan works a lot better in practice vs something truely p2p like twister or aether
we are absolutely avoiding the need to install a local application
so it'd be federated?
I'll look at the documentation a bit.
a bit more*
no it'll be p2p... <@U07GDL0H5> has started to document the architecture better here: <https://github.com/dattnetwork/dattdocs/blob/master/architecture.md>
yeah I'm reading it
wow this is a really complex design @_@
full nodes will be enabling p2p communication on both the Bitcoin network and Datt network
really really ambitious
is there code?
rtfms more

I think I could make a PoC federated version of DATT in about a month by myself, there's already a rather sizable backbone infrastructure deployed for nntpchan, I don't see why there needs to be a totally new protocol when it could be done with signed messages over nntp, but that's just me.

right now the main issue i see with my nntp architecture is that you need to trust the frontend with private keys, I could push back the boundary to do client side js crypto but that makes the tor people upset :^)
not dissing anything, just thinking out lod
loud*
np there are always two sides of the coin and we know we are choosing the harder to implement side :wink:
One thing that I think would  absolutely be an issue is vote spamming, even if you do weigh votes based on reputation
of course, sybil isn't that anyone has been able to mitigate with the current set of tools.
isn't something that*
<@U08MT2FTL>: knowing that we can’t counter sybil that’s why we are focusing on upvotes having an actual cost associated
but also if some votes are tied to verified identities clients could use this to weight vote scoring rather than going purely on value alone
